Mcmc samples

get_mcmc_samples.Rd

Helper function to get the mcmc samples

get_mcmc_samples(
  data,
  id_application,
  id_voter,
  grade_variable,
  model = NULL,
  path_to_jags_model = NULL,
  n_chains = 2,
  n_iter = 10000,
  n_burnin = 5000,
  id_section = NULL,
  theta_name = "application_intercept",
  tau_name = "tau_application",
  sigma_name = "sigma",
  tau_voter_name = "tau_voter",
  tau_section_name = NULL,
  rank_theta_name = "rank_theta",
  other_variables = NULL,
  seed = 1991,
  quiet = FALSE,
  dont_bind = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

long data frame with all information as in the jags model defined below.
id_application

the name of the application variable in the data
id_voter

the name of the voter variable in the data (default = NULL)
grade_variable

the name of the outcome variable
model

the model definition as character. (default = NULL)
path_to_jags_model

the path to the jags txt file, if null, the default model is used. (default = NULL)
n_chains

number of chains for the JAGS sampler. (default = 4)
n_iter

how many iterations used in the JAGS sampler? (default = 5000)
n_burnin

number of burnin iterations
id_section

name of the section
theta_name

the name of the application identifier in the JAGS model. (default = application_intercept")
tau_name

name of the tau in the jags model, being the standard error of the application effects. This variable is needed for the computation of the rankability. (default = tau_application)
sigma_name

name of the standard deviation of the full model. (default = sigma)
tau_voter_name

name of the standard error of the voter effect. This variable is needed for the computation of the rankability (default = tau_voter)
tau_section_name

name of the standard error of the section effect, if needed
rank_theta_name

the name of the rank of theta in the JAGS model (default = rank_theta)
other_variables

are there other variables we would like to extract? (NULL by default)
seed

set a seed for the JAGS model (default = 1991)
quiet

if the default model is used this function generates a warning. if quiet = TRUE, this warning is not shown
dont_bind

if TRUE the different chains are not pooled, and the MCMC object is returned as it is.

Value

matrix with the samples for all parameters defined in the model.

Examples

data_panel1 <- get_mock_data() %>%
     filter(panel == "p1")

#> Error in get_mock_data() %>% filter(panel == "p1"): konnte Funktion "%>%" nicht finden
mcmc_samples <- get_mcmc_samples(data = data_panel1,
                                 id_application = "application",
                                 id_voter = "voter",
                                 grade_variable = "num_grade")

#> Error in c(id_application, id_voter, grade_variable, id_section) %in%     names(data): Objekt 'data_panel1' nicht gefunden
